ccre.util

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.util.Utils

  • public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for utilities that don't fit anywhere else. Most utilites are in Mixing or CArrayUtils.
    Author:
    skeggsc
    See Also:
    Mixing, CArrayUtils

    • Field Detail

      • currentTimeSeconds

        public static final FloatInputPoll currentTimeSeconds
        An input representing the current time in seconds since a constant but arbitrary point in the past. The value is equivalent to System.currentTimeMillis() / 1000.0f - N where N is some point since when the program was started.
        See Also:
        System.currentTimeMillis()

    • Method Detail

      • deadzone

        public static float deadzone(float value,
             float deadzone)
        Calculate a value with a deadzone. If the value is within the specified deadzone, the result will be zero instead.
        Parameters:
        value - the value
        deadzone - the deadzone size
        Returns:
        the deadzoned version of the value

      • split

        public static java.lang.String[] split(java.lang.String s,
                       char c)
        Split a string into parts delimited by the specified character.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to split.
        c - The delimiter.
        Returns:
        The parts of the string.

      • updateRamping

        public static float updateRamping(float previous,
                  float target,
                  float limit)
        Run a cycle of ramping code on the previous ramping value, target value, and acceleration limit. This will return the target value unless it's outside of the limit away from the previous ramping value, in which case it will be as close as possible. If the ramping constant is zero, no ramping will be applied - the input will be copied to the result.
        Parameters:
        previous - The previous ramping value.
        target - The target value.
        limit - The acceleration limit.
        Returns:
        The new value from the ramping cycle

      • dynamicCast

        public static <T> T dynamicCast(java.lang.Object o,
                java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
                     throws java.lang.ClassCastException
        Dynamically cast the specified object to the specified class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type to cast to.
        Parameters:
        o - The object to cast.
        clazz - The class to cast to.
        Returns:
        The newly casted object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - If the specified object cannot be cast to the specified class.

      • getGenericClass

        public static <T> java.lang.Class<T> getGenericClass(T obj)
        Get the class of the specified object, specified as descended from a specified type. Used to get around unchecked warnings.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The base type for the object.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to get the class of.
        Returns:
        The class of the object.

      • bytesToInt

        public static int bytesToInt(byte[] array,
             int offset)
        Extracts the big-endian integer starting at offset from array. This is equivalent to: ((array[offset] & 0xff) << 24) | ((array[offset+1] & 0xff) << 16) | ((array[offset+2] & 0xff) << 8) | (array[offset+3] & 0xff)
        Parameters:
        array - The array to extract data from.
        offset - The offset in the array of the most significant byte.
        Returns:
        The integer extracted from the array.

      • bytesToFloat

        public static float bytesToFloat(byte[] array,
                 int offset)
        Extracts the floating-point number starting at offset from array. This is equivalent to: Float.intBitsToFloat(Utils.bytesToInt(array, offset))
        Parameters:
        array - The array to extract data from.
        offset - The offset in the array of the most significant byte of the intermediate integer.
        Returns:
        The float extracted from the array.

      • isStringEmpty

        public static boolean isStringEmpty(java.lang.String str)
        This is a replacement for String.isEmpty() for downgrading.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to check the length of.
        Returns:
        if the specified string is empty.

      • doesStringContain

        public static boolean doesStringContain(java.lang.String outer,
                        java.lang.String inner)
        This is a replacement for String.contains(String) for downgrading.
        Parameters:
        outer - The haystack to search.
        inner - The needle to search for.
        Returns:
        if the inner string is found in the outer string.
